title: Unit 4 Checkpoint: Right Triangles
description: Summative checkpoint assessing mastery of the Pythagorean Theorem and its converse, special right triangles (45-45-90 and 30-60-90), and introductory trigonometric ratios (sine, cosine, tangent) with real-world applications.

remediationResources.reteachFocus: a² + b² = c², identify hypotenuse (longest, opposite right angle), common triples (3-4-5, 5-12-13, 8-15-17, 7-24-25) and multiples
Compare a²+b² to c²: equal→right, greater→acute, less→obtuse; c must be longest side
45-45-90 ratio 1:1:√2, 30-60-90 ratio 1:√3:2, working backwards from any given side
SOH-CAH-TOA, identifying opposite/adjacent relative to reference angle, angle of elevation/depression applications

assessmentProblems.question: A right triangle has legs measuring 9 and 40. Find the hypotenuse.
A right triangle has one leg of 7 and a hypotenuse of 25. Find the other leg.
Classify each triangle as acute, right, or obtuse: (a) sides 10, 24, 26  (b) sides 6, 9, 12  (c) sides 5, 7, 8.
In a 45-45-90 triangle, each leg is 8√2. Find the hypotenuse.
In a 30-60-90 triangle, the hypotenuse is 14. Find the short leg and the long leg.
In a 30-60-90 triangle, the long leg (opposite 60°) is 15√3. Find the short leg and hypotenuse.
assessmentProblems.answer: Long leg = short × √3, so short = 15√3 / √3 = 15. Hypotenuse = 2 × 15 = 30. Verify: 15² + (15√3)² = 225 + 675 = 900 = 30² ✓.

assessmentProblems.question: In a right triangle, the side opposite angle A is 9, the side adjacent to angle A is 40, and the hypotenuse is 41. Find sin(A), cos(A), and tan(A).
A flagpole casts a 30-foot shadow when the angle of elevation from the tip of the shadow to the top of the pole is 50°. How tall is the flagpole? Round to the nearest tenth. (tan 50° ≈ 1.1918)
A ramp rises at a 30° angle and has a horizontal run of 12√3 feet. Using special right triangle ratios: (a) Find the height of the ramp. (b) Find the length (hypotenuse) of the ramp.
assessmentProblems.answer: The 30° angle makes this a 30-60-90 triangle. The horizontal run is the long leg (adjacent to 30°). Long leg = short × √3, so short leg (height) = 12√3/√3 = 12 feet. Hypotenuse (ramp length) = 2 × 12 = 24 feet. Verify: 12² + (12√3)² = 144 + 432 = 576 = 24² ✓.

assessmentProblems.question: ANALYSIS: A right triangle has sin(A) = 3/5 and a perimeter of 60. Find the lengths of all three sides and verify your answer.
assessmentProblems.answer: sin(A) = opp/hyp = 3/5, so opposite = 3k and hypotenuse = 5k for some k. Adjacent = √((5k)²-(3k)²) = √(25k²-9k²) = √(16k²) = 4k. Perimeter: 3k + 4k + 5k = 12k = 60 → k = 5. Sides: 15, 20, 25 (5× the 3-4-5 triple). Verify: 15² + 20² = 225 + 400 = 625 = 25² ✓. sin(A) = 15/25 = 3/5 ✓.

spiralReview.question: SPIRAL (Congruence): Given AB ≅ DE, ∠B ≅ ∠E (included angles), and BC ≅ EF. Name the congruence postulate and write the triangle congruence statement.
SPIRAL (Triangle Inequality): Two sides of a triangle are 8 and 13. What is the range of possible values for the third side?
